intro: Pedicularis leiandra, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which includes over 300 species of flowering plants commonly referred to as louse plants or monkey orchids. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble a monkey's face, with a prominent hood-like structure. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. The botanical features of Pedicularis leiandra make it a unique and visually striking member of the Orobanchaceae family.
